Buttons

  • Required files
  • Buttons
  • Buttons disabled
  • Buttons passive
  • Buttons container

Required files

SCSS files required: _components.buttons.scss

Active buttons

Use the class .btn on any element eg. button, anchor, div, span

Add the modifying classes to apply the secondary, tertiary and danger (delete) button styles .btn--secondary, .btn--tertiary, .btn--danger

Secondary Danger

Disabled buttons

Add the disabled attribute to a button OR the class .is-disabled is available to add if required eg. if it is an anchor or span element

The below examples use either the attribute or the class to show the styling looks the same for either

Passive buttons

Use the class .btn as well as the modifying class .btn--passive

There is an option to add an svg icon embed inside the button. See the icons example page for more info on inline icons

Button containers

The buttons have no spacing around them by default. However to stack buttons together nicely (as the examples above) add a wrapper with the class .btns-container or for inline .btns-container--inline which will add a 10px margin around each button and minus margins on the wrapper to counteract.
